intro: Cucurbita turbaniformis var. meloniformis, commonly known as the Turk's Turban gourd, is a unique member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its large, asymmetrical, turban-shaped fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces lobed, heart-shaped leaves and yellow,瓠-shaped flowers. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and edible fruits.
